title: Academic activities in universities and higher education institutes suspended until Dec. 8
byline: Academic activities at universities, higher education institutes and vocational training institutions have been suspended until December 8, 2025 due to the disaster situation in the country.

title: Railway Department announces revised time table for today
byline: The Railway Department has announced revised train operations for today (01) due to existing obstructions along several railway lines.

title: PHIU urges caution on drinking water and diseases in flood-affected areas
byline: The Public Health Inspectors’ Union (PHIU) has urged people in flood-affected areas to exercise caution when using drinking water.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Deep Depression was located near latitude 12.3°N and longitude 80.6°E, about 300 km Northnortheast of Kankasanthurai, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Landslides removal underway on Hatton–Colombo route; Public urged to remain alert
byline: The removal of landslides that occurred along the Hatton–Colombo main road has already commenced, according to Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) for the Hatton Division, Pradeep Weerasekara.

title: Nepal announces USD 200,000 in financial aid to flood-hit Sri Lanka
byline: The Nepali government on Sunday announced financial aid of 200,000 U.S. dollars for Sri Lanka to support relief and recovery efforts for people badly affected by recent floods.

title: Ella-Wellawaya road reopens for traffic
byline: The Ella-Wellawaya road has been completely reopened for traffic, according to Badulla District Secretary Panduka Sri Prabath Abeywardena.

title: Death toll from Thailand floods reaches 170
byline: The death toll from flooding in Thailand has hit 170, the country’s Ministry of Public Health reported, an increase of eight from Saturday November 29, and 102 injuries.

title: Navy rescues over 300 people following Mavil Aru tank embankment breach
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy is continuing extensive rescue and relief operations in areas affected by flooding caused by the breach of a section of the Mavil Aru tank embankment in Trincomalee on 30 November 2025, following heavy rainfall.

title: Security forces assist airline crew in flood-affected areas
byline: Security forces have provided transportation support to airline crew members in the areas affected by recent floods.

title: Vegetable prices surge at Dambulla Economic Centre
byline: The wholesale prices of vegetables at the Dambulla Dedicated Economic Centre have increased significantly.

title: Foreign Ministry establishes Emergency Coordination Unit to aid Sri Lankans affected by floods
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism has established an Emergency Coordination Unit to manage and streamline relief efforts for Sri Lankan nationals affected by the recent floods.

title: Water level at Nagalagam Street gauge surpasses 8-foot mark
byline: Due to the rising water levels in the Kelani River Basin, Hanwella and several surrounding low-lying areas are currently experiencing a major flood situation.

title: SLAF honors deceased pilot’s heroism in flood rescue mission in Wennappuwa
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) has issued a special statement regarding the pilot who was killed while engaged in rescue operations for people affected by the adverse weather conditions in near the Lunuwila area, Wennappuwa.

title: Parliament adjourned for 30 minutes
byline: Parliament commenced today (01) at 9:00 a.m. under the chairmanship of the Speaker of the House, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne.

title: Former Minister Chamal Rajapaksa arrives at Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister Chamal Rajapaksa has arrived today (01) at the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Cyclone “Ditwah” moves away from Sri Lanka; Advisory for fishermen lifted
byline: The Deep Depression was located near latitude 12.5°N and longitude 80.5°E, about 320 km North-northeast of Kankesanturai, and it is very likely to move northwards, away from the island and weaken further, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Nayaru main bridge in Mullaitivu collapses amid heavy flooding
byline: The Disaster Management Centre in Mullaitivu has stated that the Nayaru main bridge, Mullaitivu has been completely collapsed due to severe flooding.

title: 06 infants and mothers evacuated from Chilaw to Puttalam by SLAF helicopter
byline: Six infants and their mothers, who were receiving treatment at Chilaw Base Hospital, were relocated to Puttalam Base Hospital yesterday (30) due to flooding at the hospital caused by adverse weather conditions affecting the island.

title: Disney’s ‘Zootopia 2’ hits US$556m box office worldwide, highest-grossing animated movie in China
byline: Walt Disney’s animated Zootopia 2 racked up an estimated US$556 million in global ticket sales over the US Thanksgiving weekend, providing a strong kickoff to Hollywood’s crucial holiday moviegoing season.

title: 355 dead and 366 missing due to severe weather in Sri Lanka
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) has reported that, as of 9:00 a.m. today, a total of 355 deaths have been confirmed and 366 persons remain missing following the adverse weather conditions affecting the country.

title: Divisional Secretaries to be notified when distributing aid to flood-affected areas
byline: Colombo District Secretary Prasanna Ginige has requested to inform Divisional Secretariats when distributing aid to flood-affected people, and that arrangements be made to distribute the donations through the respective Divisional Secretariats.

title: India’s INS Sukanya arrives in Trincomalee with more relief materials
byline: In a post on X (formerly Twitter), India’s External Affairs Minister, Dr. S. Jaishankar, announced that the Indian Navy ship INS Sukanya has arrived in Trincomalee carrying additional humanitarian aid for Sri Lanka.

title: Parliament to conclude at 12:30 p.m.; Reconvene on Dec 03
byline: The Speaker of Parliament, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne, has announced that today’s (01) sitting for the Committee Stage of the budget debates will conclude at 12:30 p.m.

title: SLAF urges public to refrain from flying drones in disaster zones
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) has urged the public to avoid flying drones in disaster-affected zones, warning that unregulated activity endangers vital rescue flights.

title: CAA urges public not to hoard goods unnecessarily amid flood crisis
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has warned that people are hoarding goods in large quantities due to the current disaster situation in Sri Lanka and emphasized that there is no need to create unnecessary panic.

title: GovPay introduces facility to support Sri Lanka’s disaster relief fund
byline: A new facility has been introduced through GovPay with the aim of providing relief to people affected by the prevailing adverse weather conditions in Sri Lanka.

title: ‘Don’t return home until officials conduct safety assessments’, NBRO warns evacuees
byline: A Senior Scientist at the National Building Research Organisation (NBRO), Dr. Wasantha Senadeera, stated that the public should not return to their residences until officials from the NBRO’s District Offices conduct inspections and issue their official conclusions.

title: Sri Dalada Maligawa initiates ‘Social Welfare Fund’ for flood relief; donates Rs. 20 mln
byline: Sri Dalada Maligawa, Malwathu and Asgiri Chapters have donated Rs. 20 million to support those affected by the recent floods, opening a “Social Welfare Fund” to assist disaster-affected families, Diyawadana Nilame Pradeep Nilanga Dela said.

title: Landslide reported in Rambukkana
byline: A landslide has occurred in the Gangekumbura area of Rambukkana, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Ex-President Ranil calls party leaders’ meeting in wake of disaster situation
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has convened a meeting of party leaders to discuss measures to address the severe disaster situation Sri Lanka is currently facing following the recent cyclone.

title: Gold prices increase by around Rs. 2,000 today
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka have risen following a significant increase in the price of gold in the world market.

title: Sri Lanka Police grant grace period for those with expired driving licences
byline: Sri Lanka Police have decided to grant a grace period allowing drivers—who were unable to renew their driving licences—to drive without legal obstruction owing to the adverse weather conditions.

title: Australia pledges AUD 1 Million to aid Sri Lanka’s Cyclone ‘Ditwah’ relief efforts
byline: The government of Australia has announced that it will provide AUD 1 million in humanitarian assistance to support Sri Lanka’s response to Cyclone ‘Ditwah’.

title: No Laugfs Gas price revision in December
byline: LAUGFS Gas PLC has confirmed that there will be no price revision for domestic gas cylinder refills in the month of December, 2025.

title: Indian Air Force helicopter used to rescue group of individuals from Nuwara Eliya
byline: An Indian Air Force helicopter has rescued a group of injured individuals and children affected by the disaster situation in Nuwara Eliya and Kotmale.

title: Chilaw General Hospital temporarily closed due to severe flooding
byline: The Chilaw General Hospital has been temporarily closed until further notice following severe flooding caused by heavy rains, Hospital Director Dr. Sumith Attanayake confirmed.

title: Vadduvakal Bridge breaks in two places due to flooding
byline: The Vadduvakal bridge in Mullaitivu has collapsed in two places due to flooding, the Road Development Authority stated.

title: Committee appointed to investigate Lunuwila helicopter accident
byline: A nine-member committee, including senior Air Force officers, has been appointed to investigate the helicopter accident that occurred in Lunuwila, Wennappuwa, yesterday (300, Sri Lanka Air Force Media Spokesman Group Captain Eranda Geeganage stated.

title: New Zealand extends NZ$ 1 million to support emergency humanitarian relief in Sri Lanka
byline: The government of New Zealand has announced it will contribute NZ$ 1 million to Sri Lanka to support emergency humanitarian relief through an international humanitarian partner.

title: Expenditure heads of four ministries approved in Parliament
byline: Expenditure heads of four ministries have been approved in Parliament today (01).

title: IDH and Mulleriyawa Mental Health Institute not flooded - Ministry
byline: The Ministry of Health has categorically rejected claims circulating on social media suggesting that the National Institute of Infectious Diseases (NIID), formerly known as the Infectious Diseases Hospital (IDH), and the Mulleriyawa National Institute of Mental Health have been flooded.

title: RDA issues list of roads disrupted due to disaster situation
byline: The Road Development Authority has issued a statement regarding roads that have been disrupted due to the disaster situation caused by heavy rainfall.

title: Validity of November train season tickets extended
byline: The Department of Railways has announced that the validity period of train season tickets issued for the month of November has been extended until December 7, 2025.

title: Agriculture Ministry issues notice on transportation of vegetables
byline: Vegetables such as cabbage, carrots and beans are currently being received in significant quantities at the economic centers in Welimada, Keppetipola and other areas in the Badulla District, which is a major vegetable-producing region, according to the Ministry of Agriculture.

title: Tri-Force personnel continue nationwide disaster rescue and relief operations
byline: Sri Lanka’s tri-forces have intensified rescue and relief operations across the country as heavy rains and rising flood levels impacted the livelihoods of thousands of families.

title: Flood warning for Mahaweli River Basin extended
byline: The Irrigation Department has announced that the flood warning issued for the Mahaweli River Basin under Flood Warning Bulletin No. 08, released on 29 November 2025 at 12:30 p.m., has been extended for an additional 48 hours.

title: UK pledges US$ 890,000 for Sri Lanka’s disaster relief operation
byline: The British government has announced that it will provide US$ 890,000 (£675,000) worth of urgent humanitarian support for Sri Lanka.

title: Pakistan helicopter used to evacuate stranded family from Kotikawatta
byline: A Pakistan helicopter has been used to rescue a stranded family, including a 7-month-old infant from a rooftop of a house in Kotikawatta.

title: Police warn against sharing false news on social media during disaster situations
byline: Strict legal action will be taken against individuals who spread false news on social media during the disaster situation, a time when the entire nation is united, Police Media Spokesperson Assistant Superintendent of Police F. U. Wootler noted.

title: Public urged to exercise caution regarding risk of infectious and vector-borne diseases amidst floods
byline: The general public has been urged to exercise caution regarding the high risk of infectious and vector-borne diseases amid the ongoing flooding and waterlogging situation.

title: CSE’s major indices record losses
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange’s (CSE) main indices recorded significant losses today, with the All Share Price Index (ASPI) falling by 690.76 points or 3.04% to close at 22,022.06 points.

title: President AKD and Indian PM Modi hold phone conversation over ongoing disaster relief operation
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has held a telephone conversation with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today (01).

title: Individual killed in shooting in China Bay
byline: An individual is reported dead in a shooting incident within the China Bay Police Division in Trincomalee this evening (01).

title: Colombo inflation remains unchanged at 2.1% in November 2025
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) on a Year-on-Year (Y-o-Y) basis, remains unchanged at 2.1% in November 2025, compared to the month of October, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics (DCS).

title: Wing Commander Nirmal Siyambalapitiya posthumously promoted to the rank of Group Captain
byline: The pilot of the Bell 212 helicopter that crashed in Lunuwila last afternoon (30) while engaged in rescue operations for people affected by the adverse weather conditions has been posthumously promoted by the Sri Lanka Air Force.

title: China announces US$ 1 mln cash donation and RMB 10 mln worth of relief supplies to Sri Lanka
byline: The government of China has announced a donation of USD 1 million in cash for on-going disaster relief operations in Sri Lanka.

title: Death toll due to floods and landslides climbs to 390
byline: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country in the past few days has climbed to 390, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) has confirmed.
